title: Second Hughes Ministry
text:
The Second Hughes Ministry (<a href="National%20Labor%20Party">National Labor</a>) was the 12th <a href="List%20of%20Australian%20ministries">ministry</a> of the <a href="Government%20of%20Australia">Government of Australia</a>. It was led by the country's 7th <a href="Prime%20Minister%20of%20Australia">Prime Minister</a>, <a href="Billy%20Hughes">Billy Hughes</a>. The Second Hughes Ministry succeeded the <a href="First%20Hughes%20Ministry">First Hughes Ministry</a>, which dissolved on 14 November 1916 following the <a href="Australian%20Labor%20Party%20split%20of%201916">split</a> that took place within the governing <a href="Australian%20Labor%20Party">Labor Party</a> over the issue of <a href="World%20War%20I%20conscription%20in%20Australia">conscription</a>. This led to Hughes and his supporters leaving the party to form the National Labor Party, which swiftly received parliamentary support from <a href="Joseph%20Cook">Joseph Cook</a> and the <a href="Commonwealth%20Liberal%20Party">Commonwealth Liberal Party</a>. The ministry was replaced by the <a href="Third%20Hughes%20Ministry">Third Hughes Ministry</a> on 17 February 1917 after National Labor and Commonwealth Liberal merged into the <a href="Nationalist%20Party%20of%20Australia">Nationalist Party</a>.
<a href="Billy%20Hughes">Billy Hughes</a>, who died in 1952, was the last surviving member of the Second Hughes Ministry; Hughes was also the last surviving member of the <a href="Watson%20Ministry">Watson Ministry</a>, <a href="First%20Fisher%20Ministry">First Fisher Ministry</a>, <a href="Third%20Fisher%20Ministry">Third Fisher Ministry</a> and <a href="Third%20Hughes%20Ministry">Third Hughes Ministry</a>.
